body_html:
I believe this is working-as-intended.

Here's the python documentation for logging.basicConfig
https://docs.python.org/2/library/logging.html#logging.basicConfig

Does basic configuration for the logging system by creating a StreamHandler with a default Formatter and adding it to the root logger.

By calling logging.basicConfig, you're adding a StreamHandler to the root logger in python. Note that tf.logging adds its own StreamHandler to its logger. So now each log line will be sent to two streams, causing the duplication.

For reference, here's the code for tf.logging
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/platform/tf_logging.py

I'm closing this out. If you feel I'm mistaken, respond to this issue and I'll re-open.

By calling logging.basicConfig, you're adding a StreamHandler to the root logger in python.  Note that tf.logging adds its own StreamHandler to its logger.  So now each log line will be sent to two streams, causing the duplication.
For reference, here's the code for tf.logging
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/platform/tf_logging.py
I'm closing this out.  If you feel I'm mistaken, respond to this issue and I'll re-open.
body:
I believe this is working-as-intended.

Here's the python documentation for `logging.basicConfig`
https://docs.python.org/2/library/logging.html#logging.basicConfig

> Does basic configuration for the logging system by creating a StreamHandler with a default Formatter and adding it to the root logger.

By calling `logging.basicConfig`, you're adding a StreamHandler to the root logger in python.  Note that `tf.logging` adds its own StreamHandler to its logger.  So now each log line will be sent to two streams, causing the duplication.

For reference, here's the code for tf.logging
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/platform/tf_logging.py

I'm closing this out.  If you feel I'm mistaken, respond to this issue and I'll re-open.
